channel.title: My First Ever Website With JavaScript!
channel.description:
Not much to say except I did the navigation with JS all the way (HTML interpretation btw).
http://auko.freehostia.com/
Please rate the design though! I couldn't get a round layout, as its my first time doing them, so I hooked it onto the side lol:p.

item.title: My First Ever Website With JavaScript!
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

[quote=“sppt, post:6, topic:246470”][quote author=Pwnd link=topic=322943.msg2552106#msg2552106 date=1227650573]
Learn AJAX ;]
It’s fun.
[/quote]
Don’t, unless you got a really good reason to.[/quote]'Sif anyone has a reason to actually use AJAX.

I mean, look at google. All of that can be done with direct links to bullshit, but it makes everything nice and easy.
It’s a good technology to learn.

Read full topic
item.source: My First Ever Website With JavaScript!

item.title: My First Ever Website With JavaScript!
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

Cool, even though I dont understand what the javascript is doing, couldn’t you have done it all in css[br][br][size=1]Posted on: November 24, 2008, 08:01:38 pm[/size][hr]Just another thought, when doing your css sheets, or the javascript or your html. It might be easier not to paste the full link such as
http://auko.freehostia.com/img/img/layout/roundbottom.png
Because when you move servers it will be a bitch changing all those

Read full topic
